meanings.definition: The part of a solid figure that remains after a parallel plane cuts off a top portion.
meanings.sent1: The frustums of the pyramid were visible after the top was sliced off.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker carefully measured the frustums of the cone before cutting.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the cake looked like a frustums after he accidentally cut the top off.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like frustums, always missing the top but still holding substance.
meanings.sent5: In the distance, the mountain appeared as a series of frustums against the sky.

meanings.sent1: The children played with colorful frustums in various sizes.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed a building with unique frustums on each level.
meanings.sent3: The artist created a sculpture that resembled a stack of frustums, each smaller than the one below.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was a collection of frustums, each representing a different era of architecture.
meanings.sent5: The garden was decorated with frustums of different heights, creating a visually appealing display.
